reviewText: Alter World is a challenging and fun platforming game. The gimmick of the game is to alternate between worlds while navigating well crafted, precision platforming levels. The game itself can be challenging however due to it's forgiving nature, it doesn't feel like the game's overly difficult or frustrating. Gorgeous aesthetics and soundtrack give the game a relaxing tone, and help keep the game feel interesting, especially with new mechanics such as gravity introduced during the playthrough.\n\nOverall the game's challenging enough for more hardcore fans of platforming games however, forgiving and interesting to help beginners such as myself, to enjoy themselves.
voteText: 18 of 26 people (69%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Alter World is a platformer that demands ridiculous precision. From jumps that can go wrong for a millimeter, to timing your ability to shift between worlds, while falling and moving trough the air in milliseconds.

At first I loved the game, it seemed fun, I mean, the music, the art, the level design, then I hated it, for it pushed me to levels I didn't know I was capable of... It was frustrating, but in the end, I was able to beat it, I completed every level, and I can say I'm a little proud of it.

Now the downsides were:

-There is no level select, so you can't replay any level after you beat it.
-The jump felt too slow for a platformer that demanded so much precision.
-The game crashed three times, still not sure why.
-There's certain achivement that requires you to beat the game from scratch, just after beating it, but there's a workaround for that one

★★★☆☆ | It was OK

reviewText:
Alter World is beautiful platformer with gorgeous artwork and an innovative switching mechanic. There are great details and very intriguing designs in this little game.

It certainly isn't for beginners of the genre though - the puzzles are challenging and sometimes on the brink to pure frustration because you will have to time your jumps very precicely. Therefore I didn't like the fact that I couldn't customize the controls. Another disappointment was the ending of the game. I just expected more and in all honesty:
Is there anyone who wouldn't try to save the dog?! Making the player go through the whole game again to get all the achievements is just rude.

The funniest part of this game was having a friend watching and laughing about the inevitable fails.
So I wouldn't really recommend playing it alone unless you like frustrating challenging gameplay & make sure to pick it up at a discount.

5/10
voteText: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game.  Platformers and ARPGs are my absolute favorite types of games to play, and I'm interested in most things with a fantasy, paranormal, or medieval aspect.

This game seemed to include fantasy, platforming, and alternate/parallel realities that you can switch between. I thought it would compare to Chronology, Giana Sisters Twisted Dreams, and Contrast.

Unfortunately, I found myself frustrated with the poor controller function. I'm not an impatient gamer, so I hung with it awhile, but no matter how hard I tried, there was no consistency to the controls. Sometimes controller function worked the way I expected, and sometimes it didn't. In games like this, though, there must be consistency. You can't have quick-switch" mechanics if the controls are unreliable.

For example
date: in an early level where you see the text
hoursPlayed:
I couldn't move to the right or left and jump at the same time, and just simply jumping didn't get the character where it needed to go. I finally gave up and just fell off the first landing to the left, only to land at the finish line below. That shouldn't happen.

The graphics and artwork were okay and even a bit interesting from a minimalist standpoint, but I did notice the poor grammar in some of the text.

This game needs a lot of work, but I'd be among the first to pick it back up once changes are made.
voteText: February 15

I really wanted to like this game.  Platformers and ARPGs are my absolute favorite types of games to play, and I'm interested in most things with a fantasy, paranormal, or medieval aspect.

This game seemed to include fantasy, platforming, and alternate/parallel realities that you can switch between. I thought it would compare to Chronology, Giana Sisters Twisted Dreams, and Contrast.

Unfortunately, I found myself frustrated with the poor controller function. I'm not an impatient gamer, so I hung with it awhile, but no matter how hard I tried, there was no consistency to the controls. You can't have quick-switch" mechanics if the controls are unreliable.

date: in an early level where you see the text
hoursPlayed:

The graphics and artwork were okay and even a bit interesting from a minimalist standpoint, but I did notice the poor grammar in some of the text.

This game needs a lot of work, but I'd be among the first to pick it back up once changes are made.

reviewText:
I got this from a bundle or a giveaway or something. I played it after realising how long I've had it in my library and there's only one thing I can say about it that really ruins the game.

The levels are incredibly poorly made. In one level I was meant to go around the level and reach the exit but I could easily get there without going through the whole level by walking off the platform. Controls are quite unresponsive too.

It just isn't fun to play.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This game looks fantastic, but it made me cry, and not because it was so cute or whatever... no I litterally cried like a little baby when I died on a level like 500 times. It´s  verry depressing, there is this lovely character and the peacefull music etc. and you just jump...die, jump...die every ♥♥♥♥ing time. The game is revarding of course, if you beat a level after 100 deaths you get a new level wich is almost the same as the previous one, BUT a little harder :*\nThe game is a good platformer, but I don´t like it.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I really wanted to be able to recommend this game, but I just can't bring myself to it after a 2 hour playthrough, which I beat the game to completion at that time. It starts off fairly charming, but as you progress into the later stages of the game, the controls in the gravity levels are highly frustrating and then jumping at times feels like you have a sack of potatoes under your jacket.\n\nSaying that, it's not a completely awful experience, the music between the two universes really adds atmosphere to the game, but if you suffer from any form of gamer rage, do yourself a big favour and avoid.

The game was short and there isn't much else to say about it.

reviewText:
After plugging in 3 different keyboards, reading reviews, and a ton of frustration, I can confirm that the controls are most definitely ****ed.



- Visuals? Sure, they're decent enough to be satisfactory.

- Gimmick? Yeah, I like the whole world-swapping thing.

- Music? Works well enough for an indie platformer.


If only the keyboard inputs weren't constantly eaten, this would be a 6/10 game (and therefore worthy of a thumbs up). However, this is simply not the case. If this is fixed at any time, I will happily revist this game and play it through in its entirety.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Clunky controls. cant move and change worlds at the same time though changing worlds while moving seems to be a cornerstone of most puzzles. Not a fun game at all. :(
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: This is one of the worst platformer games i have ever played, half the time the controlls wouldnt work at all and the other half they where tempremental. The hit boxes of nearly everything are just plain wrong, i found my self falling through platforms when im clearly on them and being hit by thorns when im not even close to them.\n\nThe music and atmosphere are great the idea of the game is simple and i love it  a simple back to the roots platformer which is why it angered me so much that this was soo poorly made. Please i beg you creator to go back and rework your programming being it feels near unplayable. The biggest problem i had was with the changing words, half the time it just would work at all and i owuld have to reset the level the other half it would instantly change back after pressing it like i was meant to hold it

reviewText:
After plugging in 3 different keyboards, reading reviews, and a ton of frustration, I can confirm that the controls are most definitely ****ed.



- Visuals? Sure, they're decent enough to be satisfactory.

- Gimmick? Yeah, I like the whole world-swapping thing.

- Music? Works well enough for an indie platformer.


If only the keyboard inputs weren't constantly eaten, this would be a 6/10 game (and therefore worthy of a thumbs up). However, this is simply not the case. If this is fixed at any time, I will happily revist this game and play it through in its entirety.
